boofcv.examples.imageprocessing

Class ExampleMultiSpectralImages

  • java.lang.Object
    • boofcv.examples.imageprocessing.ExampleMultiSpectralImages

  • public class ExampleMultiSpectralImages
extends java.lang.Object

    MultiSpectral images are one way in which color images can be stored and manipulated inside of BoofCV. Inside of a MultiSpectral image each color band is stored as an independent ImageSingleBand. This is unlike the more common interleaved format where color information is stored in the same image.

    The main advantage of MultiSpectral is the ease at which gray scale operations can be applied to each band independently with no additional code. This is particularly useful in a library, such as BoofCV, which is heavily focused on gray scale image processing and computer vision. The are also situations for some scientific applications where processing each band independently makes more sense.
